args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor the ＂Skyborne Spectacle＂ event.
Thank you so much for saving the village.\nNow we can celebrate the Lunar New Year\nin a peaceful fashion.
Ah, but this does feel nostalgic.\nI've not seen it since I set out on my\nwanderings.
Well, it seems the party is in full swing,\nso perhaps it's time to depa—
Ah, Su Fang. Do you need something?
I've been looking everywhere for you!\nYou just suddenly disappeared.
Anyway, the festival's just getting started,\nso let's have some fun together!
My apologies, but I will not be staying\nin the village for long.
Of course, I find it rather thrilling.
Well, that's good to hear. Still, if you're\na fan of festivals, why are you leaving?
Please don't tell me you don't like\nPeng Lai itself!
Goodness, but you are a paranoid one.\nListen to me, Su Fang...

First and foremost, you must understand
that I am not in a position to speak on
things I like or dislike in regard to
this village.
I gave up this village. I gave up my home.
I guess you've had a fair share of things\nhappen in your life as well.
Well, if that's how it is, I understand.
Good. Then I bid you fare...
Er, Su Fang? Please let go of me.
Sorry, no can do. I need you to stay here\nand enjoy the festival until the very\nlast cart is rolled away.
You just said you understood my\nfeelings in this matter.
Yes. I understand that even you need\na hometown.
A place to warmly welcome you just as\nit did myself after life crushed my dreams\nand took my parents from me.
I don't know why you left Peng Lai.
But since you clearly don't hate it,\nI think it's still your home.
So maybe just stay and enjoy the festival.\nAnd after that...just stay? Here, I mean.
I'm sorry, but that is impossible.
Su Fang is totally right about this!\nDon't you think so, Xiao Lei?
Hmm, yes. It appears to me that Ku Hai\nhimself still has a lingering attachment\nto this place.
Must I explain myself to\nboth of you as well?!
Hee hee! Sorry. I wasn't TRYING to\neavesdrop. It just kinda...happened.
There just didn't seem to be a good\nmoment to speak up...
Anyway, like my master used to say,\n＂Training isn't over until you're\nall the way home!＂
So if you have a home you can actually\nreturn to, why not do it?
The matter is not so simple.
It's plenty simple! I mean, it's not like\nthis village kicked you out, right?
So it's up to you whether or not\nyou want to go back.
I admit I sometimes think upon my\nhometown with an excess of warmth\nduring my wanderings.
However, I must gird myself against those\nfeelings. For to allow my heart to rely on\nsuch things would be a form of weakness.
Weakness of the heart dulls one's blade.\nAnd so encumbered, I would be unable to\nmake good on my long-held desire.
Thus did I cast everything aside.\nRespite, connections with others—all of it.
...Right. That's how you freed yourself\nfrom any hesitation...
Which is why you're also casting aside\nyour relationship with all of us, right?
Okay, I understand that. But I'm still\nnot going to forget the times we fought\ntogether—or this time!
Peng Lai always says the folks in this\nvillage are his children, which means\nwe're all family in a way.
And in that case, we'll never really be\napart from each other! I mean, we're\nnot numbers—we can't be divided up.
You feel this way as well?
...No, I am sorry. No matter what you say,\nI cannot remain here. But know that my\ngratitude for your kind feelings is real.
And out of respect for those feelings,\nI will stay here and enjoy the festival.\nIs that an acceptable compromise?
Finally! Now let's hit the food carts,\n'cause I could eat a dragon right now!
You nearly bought out an entire food cart\nearlier! How can you still be hungry?
Ha ha! Just save some for me and\nKu Hai, all right?
(I swore never to return to this village\nuntil I accomplished my goal, and yet\nhere I find myself.)
(A place to return to... A home.)
Ku Hai, look! It's an acrobat troupe!
A Lunar New Year performance, is it?\nMmm, they ARE quite spectacular.
When I was young, I stood in this same\nspot and looked upon performers much\nlike these.
Wooow, they're amazing!\nCan I do stuff like that?!
If you keep training your mind and body,\nmy son, you can accomplish anything.
(Without that motivation, I wouldn't have\ngone to the dojo and met Master Xuan\nor Haoran.)
(It seems I am unable to completely\nsunder my bonds with people just yet.)
I was just thinking about how things\nare as you said they were.
A hometown is something that wraps you\nin a warm embrace, no matter how hard\nyou may try to cast it off.
That's the great thing about a hometown—\nit's always there for you.
So does that revelation mean you'll be\nstaying here for good?
No. I have things I must do,\nand so cannot remain.
But I think I will at least return during\nthe Lunar New Year and partake in the\njoys of the festival.
No, it is a promise. Let us meet on\nthis very spot one year from now.
(I surrendered my village, but retain my\nfriends. I can think fondly of home without\nburdening my journey...)
(I know not what twist of fate brought me\nback, but for now, I will be grateful for my\nconnection to this place.)
